attributes.action: The UK should participate in an EU quota system for accepting refugees
attributes.additional_details: Given the rapidly growing scale of the humanitarian crisis and the current struggle between EU states on a quota system, it would be strategically powerful for the UK to now opt-in to help share the burden.
attributes.background: Uniquely in the EU, Britain has refused to take part in the resettlement of the 120,000 and has a legal exemption from having to take part. The other two countries with similar optouts, Ireland and Denmark, are offering to participate.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept duplicate petitions. We think this petition is similar to yours:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/106938

You might like to sign this petition instead. It is more likely to get more signatures that way.
